intro: Laserpitium decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is known for its ability to mimic the appearance of other plants, which may aid in its pollination strategy.
